hero.title: See What Immigration Attorneys Charge for Your Case — Free and No Obligation
hero.subtitle: Fast, simple, and transparent — get personalized attorney costs based on your case, no obligation.
hero.description: No hidden fees. No pressure. Transparent pricing upfront, so you know exactly what to expect. Our service is 100% free and comes with no obligation — connect with an immigration attorney only if and when you're ready.

landingPage.textBelowImage: Stop overpaying for legal services. Finding the right attorney shouldn't be complicated or cost you an arm and a leg.

quoteModal.title: Get Quote
quoteModal.subtitle: Complete our intake form to get matched with an experienced immigration attorney

labels.additionalDetails: Would you like to add any more details about your case? This helps the attorney understand your case better.
labels.additionalDetailsPlaceholder: Optional: Share any additional details about your case...
labels.thankYouSubtitle: We'll match you with an experienced attorney who handles this type of case and they'll be in touch soon.
labels.legalDisclaimer: The information provided on this website and form does not constitute legal advice. Using this website or completing this form does not create an attorney-client relationship. All information you provide is kept confidential and used to help provide useful pricing information. For advice on your specific immigration situation, please consult a qualified immigration attorney.
labels.otherDialogMessage:
We appreciate your interest! Currently, we provide services for these main categories:
• Green Card through a Spouse or Family Member (Family-Based Green Card)
• Fiancé(e) Visa (K-1 Visa)  
• Removing Conditions on a 2-Year Conditional Green Card (Permanent Green Card)
• Asylum or Protection from Persecution
• U.S. Citizenship (Naturalization)

While we may not be able to provide a quote for other types of cases, we will forward your information to an attorney in our database who may be able to assist you. Please check back as we are constantly expanding and adding new categories.

caseTypeOptions.label: New - Asylum or Protection From Persecution
New - Removal of Conditions (Make My Green Card Permanent)
New - Green Card through Family Member (Family-Based) - Petitioner
New - Green Card through Family Member (Family-Based) - Beneficiary

confirm.prompt: Great! This legal service is for people in the U.S. who fear persecution or harm if they return to their home country. Does this apply to you?

ineligible_no_fear.prompt:
The U.S. asylum process is for individuals who are physically in the United States and fear returning to their home country due to persecution or a well-founded fear of persecution.

Based on your answer, you may not be eligible to apply for asylum. We can still try to help! Your information can be routed to an immigration attorney in our network who may be able to advise you on other possible immigration options.

inspected.prompt: When you entered the U.S., were you inspected by a U.S. border officer?

entry_description.prompt: Briefly describe how you entered the U.S. (e.g. tourist visa, student visa, humanitarian parole, employment visa, J-1 visa or another type of visa)

entry_date.prompt: What date did you enter or arrive in the U.S.? Please provide the date or your best guess. If you don't know the date, an approximate date is fine.

afraid_return.prompt: Are you afraid to return back to your home country? If yes, can you please explain why.

ineligible_no_fear_return.prompt:
The U.S. asylum process is for individuals who are physically in the United States and fear returning to their home country due to persecution or a well-founded fear of persecution.

Based on your answer, you may not be eligible to apply for asylum. We can still try to help! Your information can be routed to an immigration attorney in our network who may be able to advise you on other possible immigration options.

fear_explanation.prompt: If yes, please explain why you are afraid to return to your home country.
fear_explanation.description: For example: threats, violence, persecution, or other harm.

immigration_court.prompt: Have you ever been placed in immigration court or faced removal (deportation) proceedings?

confirm.prompt: Great! You are a U.S. citizen petitioning for your fiancé(e) to come to the U.S. to get married within 90 days of arrival?

ineligible_not_citizen.prompt:
The K-1 fiancé(e) visa is only for U.S. citizens petitioning for their fiancé(e) to come to the U.S. to get married within 90 days of arrival. Based on your answer, you may not be eligible for this visa.

We can still try to help! Your information can be routed to an immigration attorney in our network who may be able to advise you on other possible options.

applied_before.prompt: Have you ever applied to bring a fiancé(e) or spouse to the U.S. before?

married_before.prompt: Have you ever been married before?

age_gap.prompt: Is there an age gap between you and your fiancé(e)?

met_in_person.prompt: Have you met in person within the last 2 years?

relationship_duration.prompt: How long have you been in a relationship with your significant other?

fiance_location.prompt: Where is your fiancé(e) currently located?

fiance_prior_immigration.prompt: Has your fiancé(e) ever applied for an immigration benefit before?

fiance_prior_immigration_explanation.prompt: Please briefly explain what immigration benefit your fiancé(e) applied for and what happened.

confirm.prompt: You are the fiancé(e) coming to the U.S., and your U.S. citizen fiancé(e) is sponsoring you. You plan to get married within 90 days of arriving. Is that correct?

ineligible_not_beneficiary.prompt: The K-1 fiancé(e) visa is only for U.S. citizens petitioning for their fiancé(e) to come to the U.S. to get married within 90 days of arrival. Based on your answer, you may not be eligible for this visa.

prior_immigration_benefit.prompt: Have you ever filed or applied for any U.S. immigration benefit?

prior_immigration_explanation.prompt: If yes, please briefly explain the type of immigration benefit you applied for.

married_before.prompt: Have you ever been married before?

age_gap.prompt: Is there an age gap between you and your fiancé(e)?

met_in_person.prompt: Have you met in person within the last 2 years?

relationship_duration.prompt: How long have you been in a relationship with your significant other?

confirm.prompt: Great! You got your green card through marriage and it's valid for 2 years (conditional green card), correct?

ineligible.prompt: Green cards based on marriage can be conditional (valid for 2 years) or permanent (valid for 10 years). Based on your answer, you may not have a conditional green card.

already_submitted.prompt: Have you already submitted your application to remove the conditions on your green card? (Form I-751)

if_submitted_how.prompt: If yes, did you file it together with your spouse or on your own?

green_card_start_date.prompt: What is the start date on your green card? An approximate month / year is fine.

marital_evidence_scale.prompt: On a scale of 1-10, how much marital evidence did you submit with your original green card application? (1= very little and 10 = a lot)

filing_type.prompt: How will you file your application?

spouse_involvement.prompt: How involved will your spouse be in your case?

options.label: Fully involved - will help provide documents and cooperate with the process
Somewhat involved - may help with some things, but not fully sure yet
Not involved - will not help or provide any documents

marital_situation.prompt: What is your current marital situation?

confirm.prompt: Great! This is for people getting a green card through a U.S. citizen or lawful permanent resident family member (like a spouse, parent, sibling or child). Is that your situation?

ineligible.prompt:
This is for people getting a green card through a U.S. citizen or lawful permanent resident family member (like a spouse, parent, or child). Based on your answer, you may not be applying for a family petition.

We can still help! Your information can be sent to an immigration attorney in our network, who can review your situation and discuss other options.

relationship.prompt:
What is your relationship to the person who is sponsoring you?

Select the option that best describes your relationship.

options.label: Spouse - The person sponsoring me is my husband or wife
Parent - The person sponsoring me is my parent
Child - The person sponsoring me is my adult child (21 or older)
Sibling - The person sponsoring me is my brother or sister
Stepparent / Stepchild - The person sponsoring me is my stepparent or stepchild

sponsor_status.prompt:
What is the current U.S. immigration status of the person sponsoring you?

(Select one)

sponsored_before.prompt: Has the person sponsoring you ever sponsored you before?

sponsored_before_description.prompt: If you were sponsored before, can you briefly explain the situation?

applied_before.prompt: Have you ever applied for any U.S. immigration benefit (such as a visa or a green card)?

applied_before_description.prompt:
Please briefly explain what type of immigration benefit you applied for.

(Example: visitor visa, employment visa, student visa, J1, etc)

border_inspection.prompt: If you are currently in the U.S., when you entered were you inspected by a U.S. border officer (CBP)?

options.label: Yes - I was inspected and admitted
No - I entered without being inspected

times_entered_illegally.prompt: If you entered the U.S. without being inspected by a U.S. border officer (CBP), how many times did this happen?

entry_visa_type.prompt:
How did you enter the United States?

(Choose the option that best describes your entry.)

visa_violations.prompt:
Have you ever stayed in the U.S. longer than you were allowed to stay or violated the terms of your visa?

(This means staying past the date on your I-94 or working without permission or doing anything your visa does not allow).

immigration_court.prompt: Have you ever been in immigration court or removal proceedings?

marital_status.prompt: Are you currently married or have you been married in the past?

options.label: Yes, married before - ended in divorce, annulment or spouse passed away

criminal_history.prompt: Have you ever committed a crime or offense that might make you ineligible for a U.S. immigration benefit?

criminal_details.prompt: If yes, please briefly explain what happened:

confirm.prompt: Great! This is for people getting a green card through a U.S. citizen or lawful permanent resident family member (like a spouse, parent, sibling or child). Is that your situation?

ineligible.prompt:
This is for people getting a green card through a U.S. citizen or lawful permanent resident family member (like a spouse, parent, or child). Based on your answer, you may not be applying for a family petition.

We can still help! Your information can be sent to an immigration attorney in our network, who can review your situation and discuss other options.

relationship.prompt:
What is your relationship to the person you're sponsoring?

Select the option that best describes your relationship. This information helps the attorney understand your situation and guide you properly.

options.label: Spouse - I am married to the person I'm sponsoring
Parent - I am the parent of the person I'm sponsoring
Child - I am the adult child (21 years or older) of the person I'm sponsoring
Sibling - I am the sibling (brother/sister) of the person I'm sponsoring
Stepparent - I am the stepparent of the person I'm sponsoring (stepchild, under 21 years old)

status.prompt: What is your current U.S. immigration legal status (this refers to you - the petitioner sponsoring your relative)?

options.label: I am a lawful permanent resident (green card holder)

citizenship_method.prompt: How did you obtain U.S. citizenship?

options.label: I was born in the U.S.
I became a U.S. citizen through naturalization

green_card_method_naturalized.prompt: If naturalized, how did you obtain your green card?

options.label: Marriage to a U.S. citizen or green card holder
Family sponsorship (other than marriage, e.g. parent, sibling, adult child of U.S. citizen)

green_card_method_lpr.prompt: How did you obtain your green card? (Select the option that best describes your situation)

options.label: Marriage to a U.S. citizen or green card holder
Family (other than marriage, e.g. parent, sibling, adult child of U.S. citizen)

sponsored_before.prompt: Have you ever sponsored someone or applied for an immigration benefit for someone before?

location.prompt: Is the person you are sponsoring currently inside or outside the U.S.?

border_inspection.prompt: If the person you are sponsoring is currently in the U.S., were they inspected by a U.S. border officer when they entered?

options.label: Yes - they were inspected and admitted
No - they entered without being inspected

times_entered_illegally.prompt: If the person you are sponsoring has entered the U.S. without being inspected by a U.S. border officer, how many times did this happen?

entry_visa_type.prompt: How did the person you are sponsoring enter the U.S.?

visa_violations.prompt:
Has the person you are sponsoring ever stayed in the U.S. longer than you were allowed or violated the terms of your visa?

(This means staying past the date on your I-94 / entry papers, working without permission or doing anything your visa did not allow)

immigration_court.prompt: Has the person you are sponsoring ever been in immigration court or removal proceedings?

beneficiary_marital_status.prompt: Is the person you are sponsoring currently married, or have they been married in the past?

options.label: Yes, married before - ended in divorce, annulment, or spouse passed away

beneficiary_applied_before.prompt: Has the person you are sponsoring ever applied for an immigration benefit?

beneficiary_application_description.prompt: Please briefly explain the immigration benefit that they've applied for.

other_assistance_type.prompt: What type of legal assistance or immigration help do you need?
